image.altText: A sea of flowers with a group of people surrounding it

props.synopsis: Investigators are continuing to probe suspected links to Islamic State and a trip the father and son took to the Philippines prior to Sunday's attack. Follow live.

title.children: First Bondi terror attack funeral begins

image.altText: A man and woman in sunglasses look on emotionally in a crowd, as the woman leans on the man's shoulder

props.synopsis: In the chaotic hours after the Bondi shooting, bystanders, surf lifesavers and emergency services rushed to the victims to provide first aid.

title.children: Crisis teams offer psychological first aid to those affected by Bondi shooting

image.altText: Opposition leader Sussan Ley standing up a a press conference at the scene of the Bondi attack

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley will head the internal group aiming to intensify scrutiny of the federal government's response to antisemitism.

title.children: Coalition launches antisemitism taskforce after Bondi terror attack

image.altText: A young boy walking with his parents down a street.

props.synopsis: A mother throws herself and her daughter into a pit to avoid bullets as her husband goes searching for her among the bodies of the dead at Bondi.

title.children: 'Threw ourselves into that pit': How a mother saved her daughter at Bondi

image.altText: Australia batter Steve Smith walks off the Adel;aide Oval with Australian team security.

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia reveals "symptoms including nausea and dizziness" forced Steve Smith to withdraw from the third Test in Adelaide, as England makes a double breakthrough early on day one. Follow live.

title.children: Recalled Khawaja to the crease after 'potential vestibular issue' sidelines Smith

image.altText: Tom Silvagni, whose name was suppressed throughout his criminal proceedings, pictured in a suit outside court.

props.synopsis: Tom Silvagni, son of former AFL star Stephen Silvagni, will have to serve at least three years and three months of his sentence.

title.children: Breaking: Tom Silvagni, son of AFL star, sentenced to six years' jail for rape

image.altText: A close up image of donald trump speaking at the wihte house

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump's move comes a week after the United States seized a sanctioned oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela.

title.children: Breaking: Trump orders blockade of oil tankers travelling to and from Venezuela

image.altText: Nick Reiner on the red carpet in September 2025

props.synopsis: Prosecutors will charge the son of film director Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner with two counts of murder.

title.children: Nick Reiner to be charged over Rob Reiner's death

image.altText: The front of a budget book with a navy cover and Australian government logo printed on it that says "Budget 2025-26".

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers will today hand down a Mid-Year Economic and Fiscal Outlook showing an $8.4 billion improvement to the budget bottom line. Follow live.

title.children: Chalmers to hand down mid-year budget update

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: CSIRO cash boost to go towards artificial intelligence, critical minerals
Gun law reform not a 'substitute' for action on antisemitism, PM says
PM says there have 'quite clearly' been issues in Australia's intelligence and policing systems

image.altText: Exterior of the fitzroy community school - a brick building painted with a mural of rolling fields with a sunset

props.synopsis: The school that inspired author John Marsden is facing potential legal action from parents over allegations of physical abuse.

title.children: 'Alternative' school branded 'cult-like' faces abuse allegations

image.altText: An empty and dirty glass mineral water bottle held up in a forest.

props.synopsis: Searchers find a water bottle and a garbage bag that may have been used as a poncho in the Tasmanian bushland where Belgian tourist Celine Cremer went missing.

title.children: Water bottle and 'makeshift poncho' found in search for Celine Cremer

image.altText: RBA sign behind market graphics

props.synopsis: Major bank economics teams are rushing to change their cash rate calls ahead of next year. The ASX drops for its third straight day as it follows a mostly negative session on Wall Street, while the price of oil has drops to its lowest level in four years. Follow live.

title.children: Westpac removes rate cut call, now sees RBA on 'extended hold' in 2026

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Star Entertainment appoints Bruce Mathieson Jr as new CEO
Miners among the best performers on Australian share market
Treasury Wine Estates cancels remaining share buyback, forecasts lower first-half earnings

image.altText: A composite image of three men

props.synopsis: Marathon talks between the US and Ukraine led to "not perfect" but "very workable" framework that could bring to an end Russia's near four-year-old invasion, the Ukrainian president says.

title.children: Ukraine peace deal could be presented to Russia within days: Zelenskyy

image.altText: A man with a neutral expression looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: A judge at the Old Bailey rules Ioan Alexandru-Pintaru, who stabbed a young Australian girl in Leicester Square last year, will be detained at a mental hospital indefinitely.

title.children: Man who stabbed 11yo Aussie tourist in London to be detained indefinitely

image.altText: A man sits on the beach wearing a Christmas hat looking out to sea

props.synopsis: Some forecasts will tell you the weather 28 days from now.  But is it accurate?

title.children: Here's when the Christmas forecast moves from an educated guess to something useful

image.altText: Ali Elmoubayed in tracksuit outside court

props.synopsis: The alleged "onshore leader" of Sydney's fracturing Alameddine crime family has been charged with conspiring to murder two underworld adversaries.

title.children: Alleged 'onshore' Sydney crime boss charged with conspiracy to murder rival

image.altText: image of hands in lap holding sanitary pads

props.synopsis: Share the Dignity and the Australian Society of Psychological Medicine back calls for vending machines providing pads, tampons and underwear in NSW hospitals.

title.children: Campaign for free period products in vending machines at NSW hospitals

image.altText: close up of child's foot playing with soccer ball on the grass

props.synopsis: Many parents are aware posting photos of their children online comes with risk. But it's not only images that can be harmful for your child.

title.children: Why photos are not the most harmful thing we share about our kids online

image.altText: Two sea lion pups with one draped over the other

props.synopsis: Australia's sea lion population has had a tough winter with rising pup mortalities amid the algal bloom, but dedicated researchers are doing everything they can to help their survival as a species.

title.children: Hope for Australia's sea lions amid more pup deaths

image.altText: GettyImages-2250489091

props.synopsis: Cameron Green earns a massive payday on the eve of the Adelaide Test, creating history in the Indian Premier League.

title.children: Aussie makes history as highest-priced overseas IPL player in record deal

image.altText: GettyImages-2244892355

props.synopsis: FIFA backtracks on high-priced World Cup tickets, with a limited amount of seats to be made available for less than $100.

title.children: FIFA offers pool of lower-priced World Cup tickets following backlash

image.altText: Jim Chalmers at a press conference at Parliament House

props.synopsis: A combination of savings and higher tax takes have delivered an $8.4 billion improvement to the federal budget's bottom line, the mid-year update is expected to show when it is released on Wednesday.

title.children: Budget update to show $8.4b improvement to bottom line

image.altText: A picture of Matthew Perry at a film premiere.

props.synopsis: A doctor involved in supplying ketamine to Friends actor Matthew Perry before his overdose death is sentenced to eight months of home confinement.

title.children: Doctor who helped supply ketamine to Matthew Perry sentenced to home detention

image.altText: A yacht in the water seen from a rescue helicopter.

props.synopsis: Police release video showing two men being winched to safety after abandoning their yacht in rough seas off Lakes Entrance.

title.children: Sailors rescued from yacht off Victoria's coast

image.altText: A woman and child reading on a beach.

props.synopsis: As Christmas approaches, it's time to prepare for a great but undeclared festive tradition: Not reading the many books we'll be kindly given as presents. Why do we do this to each other?

title.children: We keep giving each other books at Christmas we may never read

image.altText: Two nurses walk down a hospital corridor seen from behind.

props.synopsis: The nurses' union in Tasmania wants to see private security guards in public hospitals replaced with support officers trained in de-escalation, after a review found "overwhelming dissatisfaction" among staff.

title.children: Security guards 'on phones', absent when needed, hospital review finds

image.altText: A dark blue sky, with the black silhouette of a wire fence.

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal-owned business is suing the NT government for allegedly withholding more than $1 million in payments as part of a "campaign" to remove its contract for delivering alternatives to youth detention.

title.children: NT government accused of 'campaign' to axe youth justice contract

image.altText: outside of unit block, fire on bottom well lit

props.synopsis: Four people remain in hospital with minor injuries after jumping for their lives from a burning apartment building.

title.children: Four people jump for their lives from burning apartment block

image.altText: A man holding a fish

props.synopsis: An important apex predator died out 100 years ago due to overfishing and land clearing. Now, a close relative is bringing balance back to the habitat.

title.children: Apex predator returns to major river system, 100 years after extinction event

image.altText: A waterway closed over by sand.

props.synopsis: A 67-year-old Victorian man has been found dead, and a 74-year-old Victorian man is still missing in waters off Cape Jaffa after they failed to return from fishing.

title.children: Search resumes for second man missing off SA coast

image.altText: Tina Tran has dark clothing and long dark hair. She stands in a university hallway, students in the background.

props.synopsis: A south-west Sydney graduate who received disappointing final exam results is now pursuing a career in social work, encouraging high school students to avoid pinning their future goals to their grades.

title.children: Student ‘devastated’ by ATAR outcome now on path to dream job

image.altText: A drone shot of a beach

props.synopsis: Road signs are commonly taken from the popular tourist town of Bremer Bay, but the local shire is warning the theft of a rip warning sign at a local beach meant visitors did not get crucial safety information.

title.children: Woman rescued after rip warning sign stolen from WA beach

image.altText: Man wearing cap sitting in a car.

props.synopsis: Experts call for urgent action to turn around an "unacceptable" decline in testing for a disease that kills 20 people every day.

title.children: Thousands of Australians unaware they have serious lung condition

image.altText: Rob Reiner and Christopher Guest in the film This Is Spinal Tap.

props.synopsis: Rob Reiner directed some classic films, many of which contained quotable lines that stuck around long after he yelled "cut!"

title.children: Rob Reiner's classic films and the lines that have endured
